thread.title: Emmerdale boss Iain MacLeod hints he'll soon ask Andy Sugden actor Kelvin Fletcher to return
thread.title_full: Emmerdale boss Iain MacLeod hints he'll soon ask Andy Sugden actor Kelvin Fletcher to return

author: Nicola Agius
title: Emmerdale boss Iain MacLeod hints he'll soon ask Andy Sugden actor Kelvin Fletcher to return
text:
Emmerdale boss Iain MacLeod hints he'll soon ask Andy Sugden actor Kelvin Fletcher to return The star left the soap last summer after his character was framed for shooting Lawrence White Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Emmerdale boss Iain MacLeod has teased Andy Sugden will return. 
The soap favourite is currently on the run after Chrissie White tried to frame him for shooting her father Lawrence. 
However, with him now in the clear following Lachlan's confession, fans are hoping he'll come back in the not too distant future. 
But has actor Kelvin Fletcher , who played Andy for 20 years, been asked to reprise his character? Andy Sugden 
"There are no plans to do that at the moment, but I'd have to be an idiot not to have it in the back of my mind, as Andy Sugden is such a huge character and Kelvin's an amazing actor," producer Ian admitted. Read More Emmerdale fans in shock as Lachlan White is charged with attempted murder after confessing to shooting Lawrence 
He added: "There's nothing on the table to that effect at present, but I never stop thinking about random, surprising things that might happen or people who may return, so I wouldn't rule it out." Lawrence White [JOHN BOWE] collapses in the cafe and Ronnie [JOHN McARDLE] runs to his aid (Photo: ITV) 
Sounds promising! 
During an interview following his departure from Emmerdale last summer, Kelvin admitted he would love to come back. 
"People have said they hope he's not leaving forever, but I really don't know what the future holds. For me Andy is a character I've grown to love and who I'll never forget," he said. Everyone waits in the marquee for the wedding and Lawrence's about to tell everyone that it's off when Bernice interrupts him but to say what? Meanwhile, Andy waits outside the venue, bracing himself to go in and stop the wedding. Will the wedding go ahead? (Photo: ITV) 
"I'd leave any exciting future storylines in the capable hands of the talented producers, storylines and writers. For me as an actor, I still feel like I could give more with the part of Andy and I always will. But at this moment in time, I want to try a different challenge." 
We guess we'll have to watch this space... 
Emmerdale airs weeknights at 7pm on ITV, with an extra episode at 8pm on Thursdays. Like us on Facebook
